intro: Chamaesyce crassinodis, commonly known as the broad-nodular sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial herb that thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant features small, clustered leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It has a compact growth habit with multiple stems arising from the base, and its leaves are typically fleshy and succulent. Chamaesyce crassinodis is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
